intro: Haematostaphis barteri, commonly known as the red-stemmed heath, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and distinctive red stems. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, often clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is adapted to humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
